intro: Corunastylis parvicalla, commonly known as the small-flowered corunastylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
